image.altText: A woman with black a ponytail wipes her eyes with a tissue as she looks down at a photo album crying.

props.synopsis: Speaking to Stateline, the mother of five-year-old Rozalia Spadafora, who died at Canberra Hospital the day after her birthday in 2022, says the coronial inquest into her death had too narrow a focus.

title.children: Focus of inquest into 5yo's death too narrow, mother says

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 50-year-old Canberra man who fled to Spain and hid out for three years to avoid charges including rape and incest allegedly committed against his stepdaughter has his request to be sent to a mental health facility denied.

title.children: Canberra man to face incest and rape charges after extradition from Spain

image.altText: two women sitting at a table looking through documents

props.synopsis: It's been a long and exhausting journey, and even a legally-binding order made by a civil tribunal may not have brought their fight to an end.

title.children: 'We just want to have long service leave': Workers' long fight for entitlements

image.altText: A young man with short dark hair and glasses stands on the steps of a blood donation centre smiling.

props.synopsis: With regular donors away or out of routine, the Red Cross Lifeblood Service often experiences blood shortages over the holidays, but this year demand in Canberra is at a 12-year high.

title.children: Plasma helped Dhruvan recover from a rare disorder. He's calling for more donors

image.altText: Caravan on road

props.synopsis: The tragic death of a man struck by a loose object from a passing caravan has prompted a renewed warning about safety on the roads.

title.children: Friend of man killed in freak caravan incident near Yass calls for specialised driver training

image.altText: A man faces the camera in a mughsot, with long dark braids and wearing a blue t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Police were searching for Thor Kristiansen for a week after receiving multiple reports including property damage and driving offences.

title.children: Thor Kristiansen arrested after manhunt through Canberra's streets

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The man was found guilty last year of unauthorised camping on unleased national land after sleeping in his car in the National Rock Garden carpark near Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Judge finds homeless man who slept in his car on national land was parking there not camping

image.altText: Members of the public at a crowded beach during sunset.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Canberra set for warm and sunny Christmas Day, with heatwave to come later

image.altText: Michael Leunig talks about his cartoon, Musings from the Inner Duck.

props.synopsis: Michael Leunig is remembered by some of Australia's best-known cartoonists as an artist who changed political cartooning forever and left an indelible mark on our cultural landscape.

title.children: 'End of an era': Australian cartoonists reflect on Leunig's work and life

image.altText: An image of Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Chen Si-Yi, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj

props.synopsis: The five members of the group left Darwin last night and have touched down in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne this morning greeted by family members and supporters at the airports.

title.children: Freed Bali Nine members reunited with families for first time in almost 20 years

image.altText: Guns lay on a table.

props.synopsis: Australia has committed to growing the Royal Solomon Islands Police Force and establish a new police training centre in Honiara, as it tries to stop China expanding its security presence.

title.children: $190 million police deal a 'Christmas present' for Solomon Islands

image.altText: capitol hill building in washington dc in the background with a red stop sign in the foreground

props.synopsis: The president-elect had pressured Congress to tie up loose ends before he takes office on January 20, but members of the Republican Party's right flank refused to support the package.

title.children: Trump-backed spending deal fails as government shutdown fast approaches

image.altText: A woman wearing a sari and sunglasses smiles while shaking hands with a man in Indian attire

props.synopsis: Muslim-majority Bangladesh and Hindu-majority India enjoyed close relations for decades. That changed in 2024.

title.children: A political 'husband-wife' relationship has ended badly in South Asia

image.altText: A short woman with auburn hair is surrounded by men walking and looking serene

props.synopsis: The 72-year-old had the choice to stay anonymous and undertake the trial in secret. She chose the opposite, saying she wanted to prevent what happened to her happening to anyone else. WARNING: This story contains details of sexual assault.

title.children: All 51 men found guilty in French mass rape trial that turned Gisèle Pelicot into a feminist hero

image.altText: A man wearing a three-piece suit arriving at a Miami court house.

props.synopsis: Craig Wright has long claimed he invented Bitcoin, and brought a $1.9 trillion lawsuit against Twitter founder Jack Dorsey's payment company Block.

title.children: Australian who claimed to invent Bitcoin jailed for filing $1.9 trillion lawsuit

image.altText: A man is being treated by emergency services

props.synopsis: Authorities believe 77-year-old Paul Kearns survived for four days by drinking water from puddles until he was found by a bushwalker this morning.

title.children: 'Christmas miracle' as bushwalker finds 77yo man missing since Monday

image.altText: A tight selfie shot of a man smiling outdoors.

props.synopsis: Some of the 12 women and girls who were drugged, and recorded being sexually assaulted by Adam Charles Lusk, have detailed the devastating impact his offences have had on their lives.

title.children: Women drugged, abused by Perth dad detail horrific trauma at his court hearing

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, at a press conference, holding his hand up to his head like a telephone.

props.synopsis: The Russian president says "the other side" of negotiations will need to compromise to bring an end to the Ukraine war.

title.children: Putin says he's ready to 'negotiate and compromise' with Trump on Ukraine

image.altText: City skyline silhouetted against orange sky as sun sets over Perth

props.synopsis: Perth residents are warned to brace for heatwave conditions as temperatures are expected to soar above 40 degrees Celsius from Sunday.

title.children: Perth braces for severe pre-Christmas heatwave, as regional town hits 47.5C

image.altText: A thick plume of smoke and red hazy sky

props.synopsis: Residents in the Grampians remain under emergency warnings as hundreds of firefighters battle a fire more than 20,000 hectares in size.

title.children: Bushfires in the Grampians, The Gurdies and Bullengarook in regional Victoria

image.altText: The entrance of the Darwin Local Court, on a sunny day. There are palm trees and blue sky in the background.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government says court services will be extended to continue operating over Christmas, to make sure new offenders "are dealt with swiftly".

title.children: NT courts stay open over Christmas as prisoner numbers hit new record

image.altText: Two women stand waist deep in water at a beach.

props.synopsis: People are warned against swimming at many of Hobart's beaches after industrial waste from the Cadbury chocolate factory takes a treatment plant offline, leading to untreated sewage flowing into the River Derwent.

title.children: Hobart beaches contaminated after Cadbury chocolate factory knocks out sewage plant

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: An investigation has found 18 staff either engaged in misconduct or inappropriately accessed the records of a patient who died after a hit and run crash last year, understood to be the son of the state's police commissioner.

title.children: 18 SA Health staff resigned or sanctioned for accessing Charlie Stevens's medical record

image.altText: Colourful cans of alcoholic drinks

props.synopsis: The multinational beverage company has entered an agreement to buy the alcoholic line and brand of the Billson's Brewery which had been in voluntary administration.

title.children: Coca-Cola to acquire Australian-owned Billson's Brewery brand

image.altText: A scientist surveys the Great Barrier Reef near Cairns.

props.synopsis: The mud is problematic for reef recovery as it suffocates marine habitats, preventing corals from spawning — but there is still hope the ecosystem can recover.

title.children: Mud still smothers the Great Barrier Reef one year on from Cyclone Jasper

image.altText: A couple standing in a farm paddocl.

props.synopsis: Crops have been washed away and roads left severely damaged in parts of Queensland which are calling for disaster relief funds.

title.children: Farmers, councils face massive repair bill after flooding rain

image.altText: Ness stands with arms at her side, seen from the waist up, looking straight at the camera in front of green reeds and plants

props.synopsis: Australians living with deafblindness can be at increased risk of developing mental health issues, but as Vanessa Vlajkovic discovered, communication issues and a lack of understanding make it difficult for them to get meaningful help.

title.children: I have BPD, and being deafblind made it harder to get help

image.altText: Analyn 'Logee' Osias smiles for a selfie with the sun softly shining on tents behind her.

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge jailing a man who stabbed his former partner to death while two children were in the house has spoken of the sense of "helplessness" created by the terrifying rates of male violence against women.

title.children: Judge jailing woman's killer calls out 'utterly terrifying' male violence rate

image.altText: Fani Willis, wearing a pink blouse and pearl necklace, sits in a court dock.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Trump successfully argued Fani Willis, a Democrat district attorney in Georgia, should be disqualified from the case after she had a relationship with a lawyer she hired to lead it.

title.children: A secret love affair sank a prosecutor's chance to take down Trump

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair smiles, sitting on the ground surrounded by pots of colourful flowers.

props.synopsis: Jasmine Waddington had envisioned her life revolving around sports before a medical condition greatly restricted her physical abilities at the age of 15. But she's found a new career path, thanks to her grandmother.

title.children: Woman discovers pigface passion after life 'completely changed' by POTS diagnosis

image.altText: A woman wearing black robes and a grey headdress standing at a brown lectern and media microphones alongside a picture of a man

props.synopsis: The lawsuit alleges the US government is discriminating against Palestinian Americans by abandoning them in a war zone despite actively working to rescue Americans of other backgrounds.

title.children: Americans trapped in Gaza file lawsuit accusing US government of discrimination

image.altText: A court sketch shows a three people sstanding before the court and a man (the accused) in the middle in a black suit.

props.synopsis: Accused CEO killer Luigi Mangione has been charged with new federal charges of stalking and murder by firearm, the latter which could bring the possibility of the death penalty if he is convicted.

title.children: Luigi Mangione could face death penalty under new federal charges

props.synopsis: A collection of long-lost stories and illustrations have been celebrated in the Wangka Walytja exhibition in Papunya, paying tribute to the radical bilingual literature movement of the 1970s.

title.children: Ancient stories and priceless illustrations of first contact uncovered in exhibition
